intro: Xylopia dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's xylopia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and showy, white or greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds. Xylopia dinklagei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
